key_points: Tiger Woods has maintained a low public profile since his car accident in Los Angeles nine months ago.
Details about Woods' recovery have been scarce, with occasional updates from fellow golfers like Rory McIlroy and Rickie Fowler.
Justin Thomas, a close friend of Woods and fellow PGA Tour pro, provides more frequent updates due to their regular contact.
On the No Laying Up podcast, Thomas shared that he visits Woods two to three times a week and noted Woods' recovery is going well.
Thomas remarked that Woods can participate in his children's activities, indicating some level of improvement.
Despite the challenges, Woods' personality remains unchanged, retaining his characteristic sense of humor.
There's uncertainty regarding Woods' future in professional golf, but Thomas believes Woods will attempt a comeback if possible.
Woods prioritizes being a father over his golfing career, according to Thomas.
Woods' next public appearance might be at the Hero World Challenge next month, where he serves as tournament host.
Thomas' interview also covered topics beyond Woods, including his own season, mental health, and views on the state of golf.
